html: When Assyria launches its overnight attack and destroys entire cities, the Moabites resort to praying and weeping in their places of worship; but too late. Although Jehovah sends prophets to warn of his Day of Judgment (Isaiah 16:14; 20:3-4), Greater Babylon’s inhabitants foolishly assume that Assyria will abide by the peace treaties it makes and not resort to treachery: “See, their stalwarts sob in public; the champions of peace weep bitterly. The highways are desolate, travel is at an end. The treaties have been violated, their signatories held in contempt; man is disregarded” (Isaiah 33:7-8; cf. 33:1).
